name: Legal Notice - Cheque Bounce (Section 138 NI Act)
description: Legal notice for dishonoured cheque under Section 138 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881

fields.label: Client Name (Payee)
fields.placeholder: Name of the person who received the cheque

fields.label: Drawer Name (Person who issued cheque)
fields.placeholder: Name of the person who issued the cheque

fields.label: Bank Name
fields.placeholder: State Bank of India, Branch Name

fields.label: Reason for Return
fields.placeholder: Insufficient Funds / Funds Exceeded / Account Closed

body: Subject: Legal Notice under Section 138 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881
Under instructions from and on behalf of my client {{client_name}}, I hereby serve upon you the following legal notice:

1. That you issued Cheque bearing No. {{cheque_number}} dated {{cheque_date}} for a sum of ₹{{cheque_amount}} (Rupees {{cheque_amount}} only) drawn on {{bank_name}}, towards discharge of a legally enforceable debt and liability.

body.text: 2. That the said cheque was issued towards {{debt_nature}}.

body: 3. That the said cheque, when presented for encashment through the proper banking channel, was returned unpaid by the bank with the remarks "{{return_reason}}" vide bank memo dated {{return_date}}.
4. That despite the dishonour of the said cheque, you have failed and neglected to make payment of the said cheque amount to my client.
5. That the dishonour of the said cheque for the reason "{{return_reason}}" attracts the penal provisions of Section 138 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881.

THEREFORE, you are hereby called upon to make payment of ₹{{cheque_amount}} (Rupees {{cheque_amount}} only) in cash or by way of demand draft in favour of my client within 15 (fifteen) days from the date of receipt of this notice, failing which my client shall be constrained to initiate appropriate criminal proceedings against you under Section 138 of the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881, at your sole risk as to costs and consequences.
This notice is issued without prejudice to all other rights and remedies available to my client under law.
Kindly treat this as most urgent and govern yourself accordingly.
